comment: A kind of Aristotelian inference. This judgement replaces the mode of inference ~ barbara when the minor premise has a general context. Proposition 65 of [Frege1879] p. 53. In Frege care is taken to point out that the variables in the first clauses are independent of each other and of the final term so another valid translation could be : ` |- ( A. x ( [ x / a ] ph -> [ x / b ] ps ) -> ( A. y ( [ y / b ] ps ` ` -> [ y / c ] ch ) -> ( [ z / a ] ph -> [ z / c ] ch ) ) ) ` . But that is perhaps too pedantic a translation for this exploration. (Contributed by RP, 24-Dec-2019.) (Proof modification is discouraged.)
